--- title: CLI tools keywords: fastai sidebar: home_sidebar summary: "Command line tools" ---

geoget_ladsweb[source]

geoget_ladsweb(product:"Name of the product", collection:"Collection number", tstart:"Start of serach window yyyy-mm-dd HH:MM:SS", tend:"End of search windo yyyy-mm-dd HH:MM:SS", bbox:"Bounding box in format left bottom right top", path_save:"Path to save the outputs of the request", bands:"List of bands to download", coordsOrTiles:"coordsOrTiles parameter"='coords', daynight:"Select images for Day, Night or both"='DNB', repName:"Reprojection type"='GEO', repPixSize:"Pixel size in units depending on the reprojection type"=0.01, repResample:"Resampling method"='bilinear', doMosaic:""='False')

Here is an example of a .bash file to download data using geoget_ladsweb. The email and authentication token (auth) need to be defined in order for the script to work. To create an account and an authentication token visit https://ladsweb.modaps.eosdis.nasa.gov/.

#!/bin/bash -l 
bbox='-10 36 0 44'
product="NPP_VMAES_L1"
collection="5000"
tstart="2017-10-27 00:00:00"
tend='2017-10-27 23:59:59'
path_save="/srv/geoget/data"
bands="Reflectance_M5 Reflectance_M7 Reflectance_M10 Radiance_M12 Radiance_M15 SolarZenithAngle SatelliteZenithAngle"

geoget_ladsweb $product $collection "$tstart" "$tend" "$bbox" $path_save "$bands" --repName "GEO" --repPixSize "0.01" --daynight "D"

geoget_order_manager[source]

geoget_order_manager(path_save:"Path where log file is saved.")

#!/bin/bash -l 
path_save="/srv/geoget/data"
geoget_ladsweb $path_save
